node.title: Ukraine war: NZ Defence Force Hercules leaves for Europe on aid mission
node.description: A New Zealand Defence Force Hercules has taken off for Europe on a deployment to distribute donated military aid for Ukraine.

node.title: Forestry sector hopes fumigation alternative unlocks Indian market
node.description: The forestry sector is hopeful exports to India will resume now the Environmental Protection Authority has approved a new fumigation product for export logs.

node.title: Pfizer offers $100m to buy Brisbane firm behind app that diagnoses Covid-19
node.description: Pfizer has offered $100 million to buy a Brisbane-based company that has invented a smartphone app it says can diagnose Covid-19 by listening to someone cough.

node.title: 'G'day and welcome': First flights arrive as border reopens to Australians
node.description: There have been emotional scenes at Auckland Airport as the border reopened and the first flights from across the Tasman landed.

node.title: Cost blowout for Melling to Petone shared path
node.description: The cost of a cycle and walkway being built in Lower Hutt has doubled to $63m, or about $12m per kilometre.

node.title: As Covid-19 numbers fall, traffic light setting decision to be announced
node.description: The government is set to reveal today whether any part of the country will drop to the orange traffic light setting in time for Easter.

node.title: International hunters expected to target Aotearoa from next year
node.description: The border reopening is too late for this deer hunting season, but bookings for next year are already flooding in.

node.title: Greens: Ukraine weapons fund should be humanitarian relief
node.description: Money pledged toward weapons for Ukraine would be better spent on humanitarian relief the Green Party says.

node.title: NASA takes third crack at moon rocket countdown test
node.description: The test was delayed twice following a series of unrelated glitches.

node.title: Biden says Putin committing "genocide half a world away"
node.description: President Biden made the "genocide" comment during a speech on price increases in Iowa.

node.title: Sam Kerr double sinks Football Ferns
node.description: Chelsea forward Sam Kerr scored a double as the Australian women's footballers beat New Zealand 3-1 in their friendly in Canberra.

node.title: How quickly can the Black Ferns scars heal?
node.description: Every team needs someone to wear down opposition, for the Black Ferns that was Te Kura Ngata-Aerengamate writes Felicity Reid

node.title: Georgia's governor signs bill allowing guns to be carried without license
node.description: Kemp will likely spend significant time on the campaign trail touting the legislation leading up to his May 24 primary against former Senator David Perdue.

node.title: Old cement pipes leaking asbestos fibres into Christchurch's water supply, study finds
node.description: Asbestos fibres are leaching into Christchurch's drinking water supply from ageing underground pipes, a University of Otago study has found.

node.title: How the Energy Authority's new pricing plan will affect cost in your region
node.description: The Electricity Authority has finally adopted a new pricing plan for power distribution - delivering savings to some users but increases of varying sizes to others.

node.title: Meta tests tools for people to sell virtual goods in metaverse
node.description: Mark Zuckerberg wants "creators and entrepreneurs" to be able to make money in the metaverse.

node.title: Threats, slaps, kicking: Report highlights extent of violence against health workers
node.description: Violence against hospital workers is a widespread problem, but there has been little effort to address it, a nurses' union says.

node.title: Lyft, Uber bashed for surge pricing after subway shooting
node.description: New Yorkers shared screenshots of soaring rideshare prices after at least 10 shot in attack that halted train service.

node.title: Personal delivery for petition aimed at saving St George's Hospital maternity unit
node.description: A petition signed by more than 30,000 people will be handed over today by Christchurch midwives and their supporters.

node.title: Mask mandate for airlines: Will it end or be extended?
node.description: An extension of the rule is being considered as COVID-19 cases numbers rise across the U.S.

node.title: Record setting 131-pound catfish caught in Mississippi
node.description: Fisherman Eugene Cronley spent nearly 40 minutes reeling in his record catch.

node.title: Iconic comedian Gilbert Gottfried dead at 67
node.description: Gottfried died following a battle with "a long illness," his family said.

node.title: PM Ardern announces more support for Ukraine
node.description: New Zealand will deploy a C-130 Hercules aircraft with 50 Defence Force personnel to Europe to help transport and distribute donated military aid for Ukraine. Watch live.

node.title: Mariupol: Battle for key port city continues, Ukraine says
node.description: Ukrainian forces are holding out against Russia in the southern port city of Mariupol, officials say, despite some reports suggesting the battle was nearing its end.

node.title: Torrential rain expected to hit Gisborne and Wairoa District overnight
node.description: As former cyclone Fili approaches New Zealand, Civil Defence in TairƒÅwhiti is warning people to expect heavy rain, gale force winds and large swells. Audio

node.title: Etsy sellers halt sales to protest hike in commission fees
node.description: Thousands of merchants on the crafts platform are temporarily shutting their virtual stores to protest rising ad charges.

node.title: Rachel Deloache Williams on believing con artist Anna Sorokin
node.description: In 2019, Anna Sorokin was convicted of grand larceny and theft of services

node.title: DOC investigates after group skinned and ate seal
node.description: The Department of Conservation is investigating after a group occupying Mahanga Bay in Wellington skinned and ate a seal.

node.title: Georgia residents warned of invasive lizards that "eat almost anything"
node.description: South American tegus can grow up to 4 feet long, and eat turtle eggs, alligators and ground-nesting birds, among other things.

node.title: Unaffordable insulin may be a human rights abuse, watchdog says
node.description: Drug companies "know that people are dying, that people can't afford this," said one diabetic.
